feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds Wednesday... A weather front moving through the area will bring gusty winds to Fairbanks and Nenana starting early Wednesday morning. Winds gusting around 25 mph are expected in the Fairbanks area, while winds gusting to around 40 mph are expect around Anderson and Clear, and around 30 mph at Nenana and in the Nenana Hills.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:39PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... Rains continue in the Northwest Interior with additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches in the Upper Kobuk and Upper Noatak Valleys, and along the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range through Friday morning. The Kobuk river has leveled off at this time, but streams and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:39PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A low moving into the area is bringing strong south winds of 25 to 40 mph to the area producing elevated surf from the Bering Strait to the Yukon Delta. Elevated surf mainly along south facing shorelines will push waves
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 12:29PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND... A series of atmospheric rivers will move across the northern half of Southeast Alaska starting early Thursday near Yakutat, and then sliding over the northern inner channels on Friday. The heavier rain is then expected to last through the weekend. From early Thursday to late Saturday night around 2 to 7 inches of rainfall is expected
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 6:35PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Baldwin County through 700 PM CDT... At 634 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Bon Secour, or 9 miles west of Gulf Shores, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:17PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Pima and northwestern Cochise Counties through 500 PM MST... At 416 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dragoon, or 17 miles southwest of Willcox, moving southwest at 35 mph. Gusty outflow winds will precede any rain from this storm. Blowing dust will also be possible.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 3:09AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot Temperatures through Labor Day Weekend... A strong ridge of high pressure will settle over the Great Basin this week and continue into Labor Day weekend, bringing hot and dry conditions. Expect high temperatures in the upper 80s to around 100, which will be around 10 degrees above normal for this time of year. Some record high temperatures are expected.
